授業目的: The purpose of this course is to learn about minority populations and issues and to critically assess the way in which society is influencing and is influenced by power and privilege, policies, and media, etc. but also to examine our own biases and prejudices. In this globalized world we need to be able to understand and relate with people of other cultures respectfully.
到達目標: Students will learn to identify types of discrimination and racism and understand its connection in society, and to develop ways to better understand and relate with people of other cultures. Students will examine multiculturalism, intersectionality, inclusion and equity issues and diversity in Japan and in other countries. Students will also study the influences of history, economics, politics, and sociological factors for examination and analyses of biases, prejudices, shaped policies and their impacts. Specific objectives of the course are to have students: become aware of their own biases and prejudices; be introduced to some relevant theories and academic debates; be exposed to and learn from minority issues in Japan and other countries; be sensitized to intolerance that is based on race or ethnicity; and consider ways to handle these issues in an increasingly global, diverse, changing society.
関連科目: intercultural communications, international relations, intersectionality, global citizenship, peace studies
授業方法: All lectures will be in English (Advanced level). Course format will include readings, lectures, guest lecturers, facilitated discussions, analyses, and writing.

Each course is positioned within the curriculum in accordance with the diploma policy and curriculum policy established by each undergraduate/graduate school. 
By proceeding with the study of this course with an awareness of the DP and CP, the following abilities expected by each undergraduate/graduate school will be developed.
Global Studies:
1. Understanding and analytical skills regarding international issues: the ability to understand and analyze various regions of the world from different perspectives in the humanities and social sciences.
2. Problem-solving skills: the ability to proactively identify problems and solve them based on appropriate methods.
3. Intercultural understanding and multicultural coexistence: the ability to be sensitive to different cultures and to coexist with diverse cultures.
